alert.note: Alert for Clay (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 22 at 8:13PM CST until February 24 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi... Tibbee Creek Near Tibbee affecting Clay County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT TO THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tibbee Creek Near Tibbee. * WHEN...From late Wednesday night to Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Flooding in low areas on the left bank is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 19.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 23.0 feet early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.0 feet on 01/05/2015. && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Tibbee Creek Tibbee 23.0 19.0 Tue 7 pm CST 22.9 22.7 20.7 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Forecast includes rainfall on the ground and 48 hours of additional rainfall. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 815 AM CST.
